paper_id: On the Optimality of Greedy Garbage Collection for SSDs

entities.label: Write Amplification
entities.evidence: The lifetime of the SSD depends heavily on the efficiency of the implementation of the garbage collection (GC) algorithm that reclaims previously used pages.

entities.label: Memoryless Workload
entities.evidence: Here, we prove that greedy GC is optimal for workloads where the lifetimes of pages are exponentially distributed, or, more simply put, the workload is memoryless.

entities.label: Greedy GC Algorithm
entities.evidence: In this paper, we present the first detailed proof that the greedy GC algorithm has the optimal performance (minimized write amplification) for memoryless workloads.

triples.evidence: In this paper, we present the first detailed proof that the greedy GC algorithm has the optimal performance (minimized write amplification) for memoryless workloads.
Here, we prove that greedy GC is optimal for workloads where the lifetimes of pages are exponentially distributed, or, more simply put, the workload is memoryless.

mappings.label: Garbage Collection
mappings.notes: Garbage Collection is a direct match under MediaManagement.

mappings.label: Write Amplification
mappings.notes: Write Amplification is a performance metric related to SSD efficiency.

mappings.label: Memoryless Workload
mappings.notes: Memoryless Workload is a specific type of workload profile.

paper_original_filename: On the Optimality of Greedy Garbage Collection for SSDs.pdf
